title: 109_hr2869
content: The Act titled "Ending the Medicare Disability Waiting Period Act of 2004" aims to phase out the waiting period for Medicare disability benefits. The Social Security Act is being amended to remove the waiting period for Medicare disability benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to remove the waiting period for Medicare disability benefits, specifically by adjusting the eligibility criteria for individuals. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for Medicare disability benefits by adjusting the eligibility criteria for individuals. This includes a phased schedule for the waiting period reduction from 18 months in 2006 to 0 months in 2015 and subsequent years. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for Medicare disability benefits by adjusting eligibility criteria. This includes reducing the waiting period from 18 months in 2006 to 0 months in 2015 and subsequent years. Amendments are made to various sections of the Act to reflect these changes. Amendments are made to various sections of the Act to reflect these changes, including section 226(k) and Railroad Retirement Act of 1974. The amendments apply to insurance benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act with respect to items and services furnished at least 90 days after the effective date. The Social Security Act is amended to eliminate the waiting period for Medicare disability benefits by adjusting eligibility criteria, reducing the waiting period from 18 months in 2006 to 0 months in 2015 and subsequent years. Amendments apply to insurance benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act for services furnished at least 90 days after the effective date. Elimination of waiting period for individuals with life-threatening conditions under the Social Security Act. Elimination of waiting period for individuals with life-threatening conditions under the Social Security Act, amending Section 226(h) to include other life-threatening conditions identified by the Secretary and removing the waiting period for individuals with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). The amendment eliminates the waiting period for individuals with life-threatening conditions under the Social Security Act. The Secretary will compile a list of fatal conditions without medical treatment in consultation with various health organizations. The effective date of these amendments applies to insurance benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act for services provided at least 90 days after the enactment of the Act. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will request the Institute of Medicine to study disability conditions that can be delayed or prevented with access to healthcare. A report on the study's results must be submitted to Congress within 2 years. $750,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2006 and 2007 for this purpose.
